title: Harpers Ferry National Historical Park: Group Fees & Reservations
body: Group Fees and Reservations       All groups planning to visit Harpers Ferry National Historical Park must make reservations a minimum of two weeks before the scheduled arrival date. Educational groups are required to make reservations a minimum of three weeks in advance (teachers, please see our Education Reservations page for more information). Unless the group has been granted an official fee waiver, all fees apply. To make a reservation, please download, fill out, and return the group reservation form. For additional information call the Fee Office at (304) 535-2904. Group fees are assessed at the time of reservation. National Park Service employees will determine group status as commercial or non-commercial. The following is provided for informational purposes. Please contact the Entrance Station at (304) 535-6299 for additional information. Commercial Tour Groups A commercial group consists of one or more persons traveling on an itinerary that has been packaged, priced or sold for leisure/recreational purposes by an organization that realizes financial gain through the provision of the service.  $25.00 + $5.00 each (Sedan) Capacity of 1-6 $50.00 (Van) Passenger Capacity of 7-15 $60.00  (Mini-bus) Passenger Capacity of 16-24 $150.00 (Bus) Passenger Capacity of 25+ Please note that fees are based on vehicle capacity and not on actual occupants. Non-commercial Tour Groups  Non-Commercial groups entering any park in a bus or vehicle with a capacity of 16 persons or more must pay the park's per-person fee for each person on board. $5 per person age 16+ Bus Driver (1 per vehicle) FREE Any individuals possessing valid Interagency Passes (Annual, Access, Senior) and/or a Harpers Ferry Annual Pass will be admitted free of charge.  Park fees are valid for three consecutive days, beginning on date of purchase. Entrance passes are required in all park areas and fees are payable at Cavalier Heights Entrance Station, Bolivar Heights, Maryland Heights, Harpers Ferry Train Station, and River Access Parking Lot. Credit cards are accepted only at Cavalier Heights.
